item.description:
Every 2nd and 4th Friday evening is Dinner With Dharma at the Greater Boston Buddhist Cultural Center at 950 Massachusetts Avenue, between Central and Harvard Squares, Cambridge.

Peter Martin, the husband of Marjorie Jacobs, has been organizing the GBBCC kitchen while the 2 cooks (a husband-wife team who speak NO English) travel to Taiwan to experience the celebration of the Enlightenment of the Buddha; now that is REALLY "hard core" Buddhist).

6:30 p.m. Meditation (Sitting and Breathing, led by a Buddhist nun or a leader in training) 
7:00 p.m. Dinner (vegan - but ALWAYS ask because it reminds them) 
Cost (Include vegan buffet dinner) PLEASE BRING CASH ONLY. THEY are unable to accept Credit Cards!! 
Adult: $10 Student: $5 (student ID required for the $5 half price)

7:45 p.m. Dharma Talk and Discussion (scheduled to finish around 9:00 pm)

Through photographs and biographical narrative, Bhikshuni Lozang Trinlae weaves multicultural awareness and insights into tells us about her dharma practice as a western monastic.  

East-West Integration of Dharma: American Buddhist Nun’s Experience - Friday March 11 Dinner With Dharma

Bhikshuni Lozang has done education and research work in India, Nepal, and Tibet, where she underwent intensive traditional training in Mahayana Buddhism according to the Tibetan Vajrayana tradition, including ten years of solitary retreat in the Sagarmartha Mount Everest National Park in Nepal.  She is currently pursuing her doctoral research developing measurement protocols for teachers and students of formal Buddhist training to use in assessing the behavioral and developmental outcomes of their practices.

Program organized by Ven. Man Kuang (fluent in Mandarin and English) and Marjorie Jacobs. 

They will provide Buddhist (a) perspectives affirming the importance of cultivating and (b) insights relating to issues in modern living.

If you have any questions, please call Ven. Man Kuang at the temple.

Take the T to Central Square, http://www.mbta.com/rider_tools/trip_planner/
Walk in TOWARDS Harvard Square until you see 950 Mass Ave on the left (south) side of the street.

Please invite friends and family. If you have any questions, please call the GBBCC.

Greater Boston Buddhist Cultural Center - Omitofo for the event at GBBCC 
950 Massachusetts Avenue (#1 bus, between Red Line stops at Central Square and Harvard Square) 
Cambridge, MA 
617-547-6670

http://www.GBBC.net - IF you speak and read Mandarin - Chinese language site has a security warning, but it's SAFE 
PHOTOS of the Buddhist Tea House interior 
http://www.yelp.com/biz/greater-boston-buddhist-cultural-center-cambridge

http://bit.ly/GBBCC-Intro-Mandarin - Mandarin language intro to Greater Boston Buddhist Cultural Center in Cambridge, MA

For driving directions please check here 
http://bit.ly/dByxK8 - Google Maps of the Area with GBBCC
http://pluralism.org/profiles/view/74842 - HDS Pluralism Project Profile-Greater Boston Buddhist Cultural Center (GBBCC) - includes history and statistics

We look forward to seeing you there! We'll be there from 6:30pm to 8:30pm, maybe 10 pm, if we like the talk(s).

For more info. for this place, please check GBBCC photo site and Maynard's pictures of the place http://pluralism.org/photosets/view/189 and http://bit.ly/GBBCC-Photos
item.how_to_find_us: Ask where the MANDARIN SPEAKERS are because YOU want to speak MANDARIN during your visit here.Mandarin language intro to Greater Boston Buddhist Cultural Center in Cambridge, MA
item.why: It's a GREAT chance to speak Mandarin with staff and supporters AND the food (an ample buffet with many options!) is GREAT and only $5 for FT students and a low, low, low $10 for everyone else

group.name: The Boston Mandarin Chinese Language Meetup Group

item.name: Mandarin, Meditation, Dinner With Dharma:Greater Boston Buddhist Cultural Center
